70d6a68f-28d1-414d-8b98-cdd81c217506.description: The Certified Mortgage Banker (CMB) designation is the industry standard of professional success. It symbolizes respect, credibility, ethics and achievement within real estate finance. Earning a CMB instantly places you at the top of our dynamic industry and makes you a part of the elite group that has achieved the highest level of professional success.
70d6a68f-28d1-414d-8b98-cdd81c217506.name: Certified Mortgage Banker (CMB) Designation

badge_template_activities.title: A copy of your resume, LinkedIn profile, your transcript update form, Letter of recommendation and two industry references CMB Sponsor information, Photo of yourself
Candidates should have five or more years in the real estate finance industry before they enroll in the Residential CMB Program. It is recommended that a candidate have seven or more years
Your 150 CMB points are made up of the following categories: Professional Experience (Minimum: 25 points), Documented Education (Minimum: 35 points) and Industry participation (Minimum: 25 points)
Written Exam: A six-hour exam is conducted at the candidate's location by an approved proctor.
Oral Exam: A one-hour exam is conducted by CMB designee panel at locations across the country.

54c13ba1-3048-4170-ba18-324a187679ff.description: Commercial Certified Mortgage Servicer: Designation (CCMS) is a symbol of professionalism and commitment to servicing and recognizes a thorough understanding of the changing, complex and challenging commercial mortgage servicing industry. CCMS designees demonstrate high levels of achievement and command respect due to their professional accomplishments, as well as their unparalleled knowledge of mortgage servicing.
54c13ba1-3048-4170-ba18-324a187679ff.name: Commercial Certified Mortgage Servicer: Designation (CCMS)

badge_template_activities.title: Submit a CCMS Candidate package containing the following information: • CCMS Application Form • Letter of recommendation from senior level employee (VP or SVP or company equivalent) on company letterhead • Contact information from two (2) professional business references • Signed agreement to abide by MBA Education’s Canon of Ethics and Standards

Each candidate must earn at least 100 CCMS points (and meet minimum point requirements) to advance to the written and oral examination testing phase. These points are earned in three categories: Professional Experience, Education, and Industry Participation.
Prep Course: Once a candidate has accumulated 95 points and have met the minimum point requirements, they are eligible to take the comprehensive written examination
Written Exam: This exam is conducted at the candidate's location by an approved proctor.
Oral Exam: A one (1) hour interview with 3 – 4 panelists who are CCMS designees. Panelists ask questions about current/comprehensive industry issues that the industry is experiencing.

af895229-b004-470b-ae2b-53c264f75078.description: MBA Future Leaders Program is an executive leadership development program that delivers a comprehensive in-person and online curriculum for selected managers who have shown leadership interests and abilities. Summer Session: This is a four-day hands on session, that covers the following topics: Leadership Practices, Advocacy and Political Activism, and Business Acumen.

Fall Session: This is a four-day session held in conjunction with MBA's National Convention. During this session, participants will present their final projects and graduate from the Future Leaders Program.

136c77f3-e4a4-4e92-987a-6427c06098fb.description: MBA's Developing Leaders Mentoring Program is a 12-month program powered by Engage Mentoring and designed for employees’ professional development within MBA member organizations. This development opportunity allows participants the ability to grow their leadership capacity by serving as both mentors and mentees in one-on-one sessions geared toward building confidence, political savvy, presentation skills and more.

badge_template_activities.title: To participate in the mentoring program, individuals must complete and submit a full application. Applications are open to individuals who are committed to their development and passionate about the development of others.

Program topics include Leadership Development, 1:1 Mentoring, Time Management, Communication, Balancing Work & Family, Building Confidence, Team Building
